segments.pli: Aṅguttara Nikāya 5
segments.en: Numbered Discourses 5

segments.pli: 11. Phāsuvihāravagga
segments.en: 11. Living Comfortably

segments.pli: 103. Mahācorasutta
segments.en: 103. A Master Thief

segments.pli: “Pañcahi, bhikkhave, aṅgehi samannāgato mahācoro sandhimpi chindati, nillopampi harati, ekāgārikampi karoti, paripanthepi tiṭṭhati.
segments.en: “Mendicants, a master thief with five factors breaks into houses, plunders wealth, steals from isolated buildings, and commits highway robbery.

segments.pli: Katamehi pañcahi?
segments.en: What five?

segments.pli: Idha, bhikkhave, mahācoro visamanissito ca hoti, gahananissito ca, balavanissito ca, bhogacāgī ca, ekacārī ca.
segments.en: A master thief relies on rough ground, on thick cover, and on powerful individuals; they pay bribes, and they act alone.

segments.pli: Kathañca, bhikkhave, mahācoro visamanissito hoti?
segments.en: And how does a master thief rely on rough ground?

segments.pli: Idha, bhikkhave, mahācoro nadīviduggaṃ vā nissito hoti pabbatavisamaṃ vā.
segments.en: It’s when a master thief relies on inaccessible riverlands or rugged mountains.

segments.pli: Evaṃ kho, bhikkhave, mahācoro visamanissito hoti.
segments.en: That’s how a master thief relies on rough ground.

segments.pli: Kathañca, bhikkhave, mahācoro gahananissito hoti?
segments.en: And how does a master thief rely on thick cover?

segments.pli: Idha, bhikkhave, mahācoro tiṇagahanaṃ vā nissito hoti rukkhagahanaṃ vā rodhaṃ vā mahāvanasaṇḍaṃ vā.
segments.en: It’s when a master thief relies on thick grass, thick trees, a ridge, or a large dense wood.

segments.pli: Evaṃ kho, bhikkhave, mahācoro gahananissito hoti.
segments.en: That’s how a master thief relies on thick cover.

segments.pli: Kathañca, bhikkhave, mahācoro balavanissito hoti?
segments.en: And how does a master thief rely on powerful individuals?

segments.pli: Idha, bhikkhave, mahācoro rājānaṃ vā rājamahāmattānaṃ vā nissito hoti.
segments.en: It’s when a master thief relies on rulers or their ministers.

segments.pli: Tassa evaṃ hoti:
segments.en: They think:

segments.pli: ‘sace maṃ koci kiñci vakkhati, ime me rājāno vā rājamahāmattā vā pariyodhāya atthaṃ bhaṇissantī’ti.
segments.en: ‘If anyone accuses me of anything, these rulers or their ministers will speak in my defense in the case.’

segments.pli: Sace naṃ koci kiñci āha, tyassa rājāno vā rājamahāmattā vā pariyodhāya atthaṃ bhaṇanti.
segments.en: And that’s exactly what happens.

segments.pli: Evaṃ kho, bhikkhave, mahācoro balavanissito hoti.
segments.en: That’s how a master thief relies on powerful individuals.

segments.pli: Kathañca, bhikkhave, mahācoro bhogacāgī hoti?
segments.en: And how does a master thief pay bribes?

segments.pli: Idha, bhikkhave, mahācoro aḍḍho hoti mahaddhano mahābhogo.
segments.en: It’s when a master thief is rich, affluent, and wealthy.

segments.pli: Tassa evaṃ hoti:
segments.en: They think:

segments.pli: ‘sace maṃ koci kiñci vakkhati, ito bhogena paṭisantharissāmī’ti.
segments.en: ‘If anyone accuses me of anything, I’ll settle it with a bribe.’

segments.pli: Sace naṃ koci kiñci āha, tato bhogena paṭisantharati.
segments.en: And that’s exactly what happens.

segments.pli: Evaṃ kho, bhikkhave, mahācoro bhogacāgī hoti.
segments.en: That’s how a master thief pays bribes.

segments.pli: Kathañca, bhikkhave, mahācoro ekacārī hoti?
segments.en: And how does a master thief act alone?

segments.pli: Idha, bhikkhave, mahācoro ekakova gahaṇāni kattā hoti.
segments.en: It’s when a master thief carries out robbery all alone.

segments.pli: Taṃ kissa hetu?
segments.en: Why is that?

segments.pli: ‘Mā me guyhamantā bahiddhā sambhedaṃ agamaṃsū’ti.
segments.en: So that their secret plans are not leaked to others.

segments.pli: Evaṃ kho, bhikkhave, mahācoro ekacārī hoti.
segments.en: That’s how a master thief acts alone.

segments.pli: Imehi kho, bhikkhave, pañcahaṅgehi samannāgato mahācoro sandhimpi chindati nillopampi harati ekāgārikampi karoti paripanthepi tiṭṭhati.
segments.en: A master thief with these five factors breaks into houses, plunders wealth, steals from isolated buildings, and commits highway robbery.

segments.pli: Evamevaṃ kho, bhikkhave, pañcahi dhammehi samannāgato pāpabhikkhu khataṃ upahataṃ attānaṃ pariharati, sāvajjo ca hoti sānuvajjo viññūnaṃ, bahuñca apuññaṃ pasavati.
segments.en: In the same way, when a bad mendicant has five factors, they keep themselves broken and damaged. They deserve to be blamed and criticized by sensible people, and they make much bad karma.

segments.pli: Katamehi pañcahi?
segments.en: What five?

segments.pli: Idha, bhikkhave, pāpabhikkhu visamanissito ca hoti, gahananissito ca, balavanissito ca, bhogacāgī ca, ekacārī ca.
segments.en: A bad mendicant relies on rough ground, on thick cover, and on powerful individuals; they pay bribes, and they act alone.

segments.pli: Kathañca, bhikkhave, pāpabhikkhu visamanissito hoti?
segments.en: And how does a bad mendicant rely on rough ground?

segments.pli: Idha, bhikkhave, pāpabhikkhu visamena kāyakammena samannāgato hoti, visamena vacīkammena samannāgato hoti, visamena manokammena samannāgato hoti.
segments.en: It’s when a bad mendicant has unethical conduct by way of body, speech, and mind.

segments.pli: Evaṃ kho, bhikkhave, pāpabhikkhu visamanissito hoti.
segments.en: That’s how a bad mendicant relies on rough ground.

segments.pli: Kathañca, bhikkhave, pāpabhikkhu gahananissito hoti?
segments.en: And how does a bad mendicant rely on thick cover?

segments.pli: Idha, bhikkhave, pāpabhikkhu micchādiṭṭhiko hoti antaggāhikāya diṭṭhiyā samannāgato.
segments.en: It’s when a bad mendicant has wrong view, he’s attached to an extremist view.

segments.pli: Evaṃ kho, bhikkhave, pāpabhikkhu gahananissito hoti.
segments.en: That’s how a bad mendicant relies on thick cover.

segments.pli: Kathañca, bhikkhave, pāpabhikkhu balavanissito hoti?
segments.en: And how does a bad mendicant rely on powerful individuals?

segments.pli: Idha, bhikkhave, pāpabhikkhu rājānaṃ vā rājamahāmattānaṃ vā nissito hoti.
segments.en: It’s when a bad mendicant relies on rulers or their ministers.

segments.pli: Tassa evaṃ hoti:
segments.en: They think:

segments.pli: ‘sace maṃ koci kiñci vakkhati, ime me rājāno vā rājamahāmattā vā pariyodhāya atthaṃ bhaṇissantī’ti.
segments.en: ‘If anyone accuses me of anything, these rulers or their ministers will speak in my defense in the case.’

segments.pli: Sace naṃ koci kiñci āha, tyassa rājāno vā rājamahāmattā vā pariyodhāya atthaṃ bhaṇanti.
segments.en: And that’s exactly what happens.

segments.pli: Evaṃ kho, bhikkhave, pāpabhikkhu balavanissito hoti.
segments.en: That’s how a bad mendicant relies on powerful individuals.

segments.pli: Kathañca, bhikkhave, pāpabhikkhu bhogacāgī hoti?
segments.en: And how does a bad mendicant pay bribes?

segments.pli: Idha, bhikkhave, pāpabhikkhu lābhī hoti cīvarapiṇḍapātasenāsanagilānappaccayabhesajjaparikkhārānaṃ.
segments.en: It’s when a bad mendicant receives robes, alms-food, lodgings, and medicines and supplies for the sick.

segments.pli: Tassa evaṃ hoti:
segments.en: They think:

segments.pli: ‘sace maṃ koci kiñci vakkhati, ito lābhena paṭisantharissāmī’ti.
segments.en: ‘If anyone accuses me of anything, I’ll settle it with a bribe.’

segments.pli: Sace naṃ koci kiñci āha, tato lābhena paṭisantharati.
segments.en: And that’s exactly what happens.

segments.pli: Evaṃ kho, bhikkhave, pāpabhikkhu bhogacāgī hoti.
segments.en: That’s how a bad mendicant pays bribes.

segments.pli: Kathañca, bhikkhave, pāpabhikkhu ekacārī hoti?
segments.en: And how does a bad mendicant act alone?

segments.pli: Idha, bhikkhave, pāpabhikkhu ekakova paccantimesu janapadesu nivāsaṃ kappeti.
segments.en: It’s when a bad mendicant dwells alone in the borderlands.

segments.pli: So tattha kulāni upasaṅkamanto lābhaṃ labhati.
segments.en: They visit families there to get material possessions.

segments.pli: Evaṃ kho, bhikkhave, pāpabhikkhu ekacārī hoti.
segments.en: That’s how a bad mendicant acts alone.

segments.pli: Imehi kho, bhikkhave, pañcahi dhammehi samannāgato pāpabhikkhu khataṃ upahataṃ attānaṃ pariharati, sāvajjo ca hoti sānuvajjo viññūnaṃ, bahuñca apuññaṃ pasavatī”ti.
segments.en: When a bad mendicant has these five factors, they keep themselves broken and damaged. They deserve to be blamed and criticized by sensible people, and they make much bad karma.”

segments.pli: Tatiyaṃ.
